Module steurer.software_two
Package steurer.software_two.helper

Class AppointmentInputValidation

java.lang.Object
steurer.software_two.helper.AppointmentInputValidation
public class AppointmentInputValidation extends Object
This validates the inputs for the Appointment-related FXML forms. Using the isValidInput method, if the inputs are valid, the instance variables of the class can accessed, otherwise, the errorMessage instance variable is assigned a string of error messages.

    • translateError

      private static String translateError(String bundleLabel, boolean isStart)
      This prepends the word start/end to a partial error bundle label, then translates the string and appends a linebreak character. This is specifically for date/time related errors.
      Parameters:
      bundleLabel - The partial error bundle label that is to have the word "start" or "end" prepended.
      isStart - Indicates whether the date/time is a start or end value.
      Returns:
      Returns a translated string.

    • translateError

      private static String translateError(String bundleLabel)
      This translates an error bundle label and appends a line break character.
      Parameters:
      bundleLabel - The error bundle label that is to be translated.
      Returns:
      Returns a translated string.

    • validateDateAndTime

      private static Object validateDateAndTime(javafx.scene.control.DatePicker dateField, javafx.scene.control.TextField timeField, javafx.scene.control.RadioButton amRBtn, javafx.scene.control.RadioButton pmRBtn, boolean isStart)
      This takes in JavaFX nodes related to date/time and validates the nodes.
      Parameters:
      isStart - indicates whether the date time to be validated is a start date time or end date time
      Returns:
      Returns a LocalDateTime if valid, else a string of errors

    • isOverlappingDateTime

      private boolean isOverlappingDateTime(LocalDateTime start1, LocalDateTime start2, LocalDateTime end1, LocalDateTime end2)
      This compares two sets of start and end LocaleDateTime objects and returns whether they overlap.
      Returns:
      Returns whether the LocalDateTimes overlap (inclusive)

    • isWithinOfficeHours

      private boolean isWithinOfficeHours(LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end)
      This looks at appointment start and end times and converts them from the local date time into Eastern Time and indicates whether the start and end time fall within office hours.
      Returns:
      Returns whether the appointment is within office hours.

    • isValidInput

      public boolean isValidInput(javafx.scene.control.TextField titleField, javafx.scene.control.TextField descriptionField, javafx.scene.control.TextField locationField, javafx.scene.control.TextField typeField, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> contactNameField, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> customerNameField, javafx.scene.control.DatePicker startDate, javafx.scene.control.TextField startTime, javafx.scene.control.RadioButton startAM, javafx.scene.control.RadioButton startPM, javafx.scene.control.DatePicker endDate, javafx.scene.control.TextField endTime, javafx.scene.control.RadioButton endAM, javafx.scene.control.RadioButton endPM, boolean isModify)
      This examines various nodes for the Appointment-related FXML forms and determines if the inputs are valid. If the inputs are valid, the instance variables (not errorMessage) of the superclass are set, else the errorMessage instance variable is assigned a string of errors.
      Parameters:
      isModify - This indicates whether the input is intending to modify an existing entry.
      Returns:
      Returns whether the input is valid.
